oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Tennessee Union soldier James N. Levi
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from James Noah Levi to Eunice C. "Nicey" Vandergriff Levi, his wife. (See chat029 for details of Levi's service) Writes to "inform you that when I left home I travelled through the mountains 13 days and nites beefore I reatched the army." He describes his circuitous travels by steamboat and long marches through western Virginia to Cincinnati and Louisville and finally to Nashville and on to the Battle of Stones River, describing in gruesome detail the carnage he witnessed there.
